title: Old Trafford - Wikipedia
snippet: Old Trafford (/ˈtræfərd/) is a football stadium in Old Trafford, Greater Manchester, England, and is the home of Manchester United. With a capacity of 74,197, it is the largest club football stadium (and second-largest football stadium overall after Wembley Stadium) in the United Kingdom, ...

title: New Trafford Stadium - Wikipedia
snippet: New Trafford Stadium is the name given by the architects Foster + Partners to a potential new stadium for Manchester United that would replace Old Trafford, their home stadium since 1910.

title: Visit Old Trafford | Man Utd Museum, Stadium Tour, Red Cafe, Conferences, Business and Corporate Events | Manchester United
snippet: Old Trafford Stadium is the world-famous home of Manchester United, and there's plenty to do when you visit.

snippet: The world-renowned Old Trafford stadium, home of Manchester United, is a totally unique venue.

title: Old Trafford - Manchester United - Manchester - The Stadium Guide
snippet: Due to its proximity to Trafford Park industrial estate, Old Trafford got heavily damaged by German air raids during World War 2. It took eight years to rebuilt the stadium, the delays being caused by limited post-war resources, and during that ...
